current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to qualify homeless youth and veterans who are full-time
			 students for purposes of the low income housing tax credit.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Housing for Homeless Students Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Housing for Homeless Students Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Homeless youth and veterans who are full-time students qualified for purposes of the low
			 income housing tax credit

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by
			 redesignating subclauses (II) and (III) as subclauses (IV) and (V),
			 respectively, and by inserting after subclause (I) the following new
			 subclauses:

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

text.#text:
a full-time student who, during any portion of the 5-year period ending with the commencement
			 of such individual's continuous occupation of any low-income unit or
			 units, was an individual described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 725(2) of the McKinney-Vento
			 Homeless Assistance Act

text.#text:

The amendments made by subsection (a) shall apply to determinations made before,
			 on, or after the date of the enactment of this Act.
